header: Seeking a leadership role focused on sustainable engineering and management.
footer: Don’t hesitate to contact me if you need further information, let’s cooperate

headingSection.title: Biography
headingSection.header: Seeking a leadership role focused on sustainable engineering and management.
description: Bringing over a decade of diverse engineering experience, I excel in automation, failure analysis, and risk assessment. With a unique ability to bridge technical and business domains, I'm recognized for my exceptional communication skills and commitment to innovation.
As a self-motivated individual and a valuable team player, I am deeply committed to advancing green engineering solutions with efficiency and precision.

content.subheader: in Mechanical Engineering (MSME) - University of South Florida, Tampa, FL - 2020

list: Conducted research on 4D Printing, Shape Memory Effect in Polymers and Alloys, Soft Robotics and Assistive Devices
Implemented origami and kirigami techniques into 3D and 4D printed soft robotic components
Mentored five masters and undergraduate students in the lab and a 4-person capstone design team

content.subheader: in Mechanical Engineering (MSME) - University of South Florida, Tampa, FL - 2020
in Engineering (AA) - Bucks County Community College, Newtown, PA - 2014
STMicroelectronics, Inc., Fremont, CA - February 2022 to September 2023

list: Managed a newly-functional, chemically-intensive R&D laboratory, focusing on safety aspects like rule creation, program development, competency training, hazard assessment, chemical and waste management, equipment maintenance, and the shipping and receiving of Dangerous Goods (DG). Ensured adherence to DOT & IATA shipping procedures, for domestic & international shipments.

Maintained strict compliance with numerous regulations, encompassing federal, state, local, and corporate levels. This included recordkeeping, reporting, inspections and audits, in alignment with standards set by bodies like OSHA, EPA, DEA, and more.

Developed and implemented comprehensive safety programs and protocols such as the Emergency Action Plan, Injury and Illness Prevention Plan, Hazard Communication, and Waste Management Plan. Increased employee safety by implementing a myriad of safety features such as an Emergency Response Team, strategically placed walkie-talkies and signs, additional sensors and alarms, and evacuation drills.

Oversaw the lifecycle of chemicals from entry to exit, implementing rigorous management practices and providing specialized training to employees. Enacted strict measures like spill containment, scrubbers on air vents, and filters to maintain a safe working environment.

Initiated the implementation of ISO9001 and IATF16949 quality standards across the site, conducting a thorough gap analysis and formulating a plan of action. Collaboratively built knowledge and expertise to overcome the challenge of the team lacking prior experience with ISO standards.

content.subheader: University of South Florida, Tampa, FL - November 2017 to August 2021
University of South Florida, Tampa, FL - January 2018 to May 2021
University of Science and Technology, Beijing, China - May 2017 to August 2018
Medcomp Inc, Harleysville, PA - May 2016 to August 2016

content.header: 4D Printed Soft Robotics and Energy Harvesters

list: Created a polymer solution which can be used as an ink with 4D inkjet/polyjet printing
Drew inspiration from nature to create a multi-material soft robot which can self actuate when exposed to water or humidity
Implemented traditional origami and kirigami techniques to allow for pre-determined shape change
Drafted a senior design project for undergraduate students based on this research

content.header: Cold Plasma Sterilization and Static Recharge Devices
Manus Arm Robotic Assistant's Arm Lift (MARA aLift)
Robot and Simulator for End Effector Tracking and Singularity Avoidance
Active Clothing with Embedded Sensors and Live Monitoring
Lab Racing and Distance Sensing Robot
Quadrotor Design, Automation, and Racing Competitions
NASA’s Reduced Gravity Education Flight Program (MicroG NExT Program)
Theta Tau Coed Professional Engineering Fraternity

list: Collected dues, established payment plans, paid national fees, and ran financial audits
Verified all budgets for each fraternity-sponsored event before they could be approved
Kept careful record of all transactions done by any member using chapter funds
Set up a new member education manual to teach national and local fraternity history and values
Hosted weekly meetings to ensure a timely pledging process completion and instill self-confidence
Mediated in disagreements between new members as well as active brothers
Organized appealing events for brothers and new members to bond at on a personal level
Worked with the treasurer and assigned committee to create and pass budgets for each event
Orchestrated two weeks of casual and professional events to attract potential new members
Participated in elected-board meetings and proposed several mid-semester recruitment events
